issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
HivePrivilegeObject in the authorization api has support for columns, but the columns being used are not being populated for non grant-revoke queries.
This is for enabling any implementation of the api to use this column information for its authorization decisions.
fields.summary: pass column names being used for inputs to authorization api

ATTACHMENT ID: 12658057

I just realized that partition column names are not being made available in the existing logic in trunk.  Looks like I will need to check the partition pruning expression to get that (,ie examine ExprNodeDesc returned by parseCtx.getOpToPartPruner().get(ts) ). Let me know if you have any other suggestion for getting the proper tables to column used mapping.

HIVE-7488.4.patch - also supplies information about the partition columns being used. The changes is only for v2 authorization, adding partition columns won't be backward compatible change for the default authorization mode.
